It's a sweet movie with a little R ish material, not too much, but all in all a nice escape, and a movie that stands up to rewatching. Review Title: It's a sweet movie with a little R ish material Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/02/17 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Henry Singer'], 'Producers': ['Henry Singer'], 'Studio': ['XiveTV']} Review Text: They should retitle this one "The Most Narcissistic Photographer in the History of Photographs". This guy tried to make the entire story about him, a guy who pushed a button on a machine. Line after line of how he was Picasso, how his photograph compared to Pulitzer Prize winning photos, every last thing the guy said was about himself. I defy you to find a sentence without the word "I" or "me" in it. Review Title: The Most Narcissistic Photographer in the History of Photographs Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/02/17 Average Rating: 3.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Stephanie Kaim'], 'Producers': ['Irène Challand', 'Claire Colart', 'Sandrine Delegiewicz', 'Stéphane Haumant', 'Gaspard Lamunière', 'Daniel Leconte', 'Andreas Lemos', 'Émilie Raffoul', 'Olivier Stroh'], 'Studio': ['MagellanTV']} Review Text: Out after 40 seconds. I at first couldn't realize if the video was warped, or the guy had a speech impediment. No way could I make it through 90 minutes of that. Review Title: Out after 40 seconds. I at first couldn't realize ... Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/03/22 Average Rating: 3.9 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['None'], 'Starring': ['Ruth Blackwell'], 'Studio': ['Independent Documentary']} Review Text: Water faucets running and junk scattered on the floor. That HAD to be a ghost! I now believe in ghosts! This was a lower budget Blair Witch Project that was hoping a large percentage of the people were too young to remember The Blair Witch Project. The only reason it barely made it to three stars is that it's a cute couple. And they did get me to watch the whole thing. This was very terrible. Review Title: This was very terrible. Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/09/23 Average Rating: 3.2 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Lee Schloss'], 'Producers': ['Mike Bocchetti'], 'Starring': ['Mike Bocchetti', 'Artie Lange', 'Sal the Stockbroker']} Review Text: The quality of the video could be better, but the quality of Mike could not. He's got a heart of gold, and if you want to see who he is, I recommend youtubing "Mike Bocchetti and the weather". Crisp video quality, and Mike never has a bad word to say about anyone. His true comic talents are brought out by Artie Lange on Artie's show when he does the weather. Please watch, I've seen it so many times. Review Title: Mike is a 5 star person Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/10/08 Average Rating: 4.0 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['CJ Wallis'], 'Producers': ['Mallory Kennedy', 'CJ Wallis'], 'Starring': ['Ted Slauson', 'Bob Barker', 'Roger Dobkowitz']} Review Text: The guy who does the narrating (the principle subject) has this style that doesn't seem like he'd like any kind of game show at all. But it kind of grows on you. There is a surprising amount of footage that captures all of his appearances. I thought there would be a little more scandal to it. It really should be titled The Contestant Who Knew a Fair Amount. There were some tones of stalker in him, but that helped my fascination. And Holly didn't have to fear him because well, ya know, I mean- ya know? She knew.

Also, at the time when he was young, he was a good looking guy, I think that's how the models kind of liked him. In his prime, it wasn't weird to ask for a kiss from Holly. It was really sad to see Bob Barker get older, because you see the pics of him when he was younger, and you just couldn't look more alive. For even someone that good looking to get old, damn, what's that say for the rest of us.

But I highly recommend this doc for sure for sure watch it. Review Title: A really good documentary Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/10/08 Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Sally Howell'], 'Producers': ['Heather Dreiling', 'Eric Schotz', 'Kathy Williamson'], 'Studio': ['MagellanTV']} Review Text: The narrator, who looks like the kind of guy who got beat up a lot in grammar school, is a little too alarmist, and rehashes stuff the main authority on sugar has already talked about. This goofball says he is serious about exercise and then says who needs a gym and walks up a hill with rocks. Wow. I've lived in England, and just like the rest of English TV, this seems like, I don't know- practice television, and a practice documentary. Also what I've noticed in English documentaries, they seem to be fascinated by the narrator WALKING. It must be a luxury in the UK to walk, or it must denote thinking. Anyway, I couldn't make it all the way through. Review Title: Couldn't make it to the end Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/10/10 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['---'], 'Producers': ['Paul Dechant'], 'Starring': ['Paul Dechant']} Review Text: The way we think about sugar is going to change; but not from this micro-mentary. I had a longer report about sugar in 5th grade. In about 300 seconds, this snippet talks about how there is sugar in food, and they made labels to know how much.

I have changed the way I think about sugar. Also, I wish I had the last 5 minutes of my life back. Review Title: Way too long Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/07/14 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Austin Meyer'], 'Producers': ['Austin Meyer'], 'Starring': ['Austin Meyer', 'Peter Braxton', 'Alex Charro'], 'Studio': ['AMC Plus Documentaries']} Review Text: This had me thinking the next day. Somebody told me about it, and I couldn't wait to watch it, even though I have nothing to do with patents. It's well told on a low budget and you'll find out why the budget is low. I could only slightly see the point of the other side, it was cool of Oscar Meyer to include them too, but in the balance, these patent trolls are very terrible people. Review Title: Best Doc in a long while Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/09/15 Average Rating: 3.5 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michal Siewierski'], 'Producers': ['Peter Eastwood', 'Nicky Taylor', 'Gwyn Whittaker'], 'Starring': ['John Mackey', 'Rich Roll', 'Rip Esselstyn'], 'Studio': ['Gravitas Ventures']} Review Text: I'm going to wait for the English speaking version. Review Title: Not sure Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Billion Dollar Bully Review Date: 2020/06/18 Categories: Documentary, Arts, Entertainment, and Culture Product Description: ["Today consumers Yelp everything from restaurants to dentists; plumbers to surgeons. The small business community sees Yelp's sales tactic as extortion. Does Yelp genuinely have an interest in helping people support the best local businesses, or are they a pay-to-play advertising platform?"] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kaylie Milliken'], 'Producers': ['Kaylie Milliken'], 'Starring': ['Davide Cerretini', 'Amy Lane', 'Danny Teran']} Review Text: Point of the Documentary: Reviews are corrupt.
Amazon: So . . . . whatja think?

Great Documentary. God, I could not stand the snarky tone of the Yelp reps on the phone, I felt like punting them from here on the West Coast all the way to Rhode Island. And to think the person actually exists. And that Jackie Reses phone call- so glad she was exposed.

I wish this documentary not so much put Yelp out of business, but held them more accountable. And I will take the advice of the person in the doc who said don't START advertising with them, because they won't let you stop. And it IS the company culture, those are young reps under pressure from within to get a stupid cow bell ring instead of enough money to pay their rent in SF.

They're a monopoly, take them down, and I am going to visit that guys' Italian restaurant in Richmond, and if you know Richmond, that's saying something. Review Title: Oh The Irony Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Florida Project [DVD] Review Date: 2020/08/03 Store: Willem Dafoe (Actor), Brooklynn Prince (Actor), Sean Baker (Director, Producer) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama Product Description: ['Product Description', "On the shabby grounds of an Orlando budget hotel, youngsters Moonee (Brooklynn Prince), Scooty (Christopher Rivera), and Jacey (Valeria Cotto) are left to fend for themselves as their struggling parents eke out an existence on the margins of the tourist trade. A summer marked by mischief, adventure, and the de facto guardianship of the facility's exasperated manager (Willem Dafoe) is memorably chronicled in this earthy, compelling drama. Bria Vinaite, Mela Murder, Caleb Landry Jones co-star.", 'Review', 'Special Features:Under the Rainbow: Making THE FLORIDA PROJECTBloopers and OuttakesCast and Crew Interviews --Lionsgate'] Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Dolby, NTSC, AC-3, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Sean Baker, Willem Dafoe, Brooklynn Prince', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 51 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.12 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Director': 'Sean Baker', 'Media Format': 'Dolby, NTSC, AC-3, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 51 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 20, 2018', 'Actors': 'Willem Dafoe, Brooklynn Prince', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Producers': 'Sean Baker', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: This movie is destined to be a cult classic. Review Title: Great Movie Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/09/03 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Starring': ['Andy Luttrell']} Review Text: I would not see this in a theatre, mainly because it's 4 minutes, and you would drive all the way out there, sit down, watch previews for 1/2 an hour, and then watch a 4 minute movie, and then drive home? Hell no. Review Title: I Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

Review Title: It's a sweet movie with a little R ish material Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/02/17 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Henry Singer'], 'Producers': ['Henry Singer'], 'Studio': ['XiveTV']} Review Text: They should retitle this one "The Most Narcissistic Photographer in the History of Photographs". This guy tried to make the entire story about him, a guy who pushed a button on a machine. Line after line of how he was Picasso, how his photograph compared to Pulitzer Prize winning photos, every last thing the guy said was about himself. I defy you to find a sentence without the word "I" or "me" in it. I at first couldn't realize ... Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/03/22 Average Rating: 3.9 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['None'], 'Starring': ['Ruth Blackwell'], 'Studio': ['Independent Documentary']} Review Text: Water faucets running and junk scattered on the floor. That HAD to be a ghost! I now believe in ghosts! This was a lower budget Blair Witch Project that was hoping a large percentage of the people were too young to remember The Blair Witch Project. The only reason it barely made it to three stars is that it's a cute couple. And they did get me to watch the whole thing. This was very terrible. Review Title: This was very terrible. Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/09/23 Average Rating: 3.2 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Lee Schloss'], 'Producers': ['Mike Bocchetti'], 'Starring': ['Mike Bocchetti', 'Artie Lange', 'Sal the Stockbroker']} Review Text: The quality of the video could be better, but the quality of Mike could not. He's got a heart of gold, and if you want to see who he is, I recommend youtubing "Mike Bocchetti and the weather". Crisp video quality, and Mike never has a bad word to say about anyone. His true comic talents are brought out by Artie Lange on Artie's show when he does the weather. Please watch, I've seen it so many times. Review Title: Mike is a 5 star person Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/10/08 Average Rating: 4.0 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['CJ Wallis'], 'Producers': ['Mallory Kennedy', 'CJ Wallis'], 'Starring': ['Ted Slauson', 'Bob Barker', 'Roger Dobkowitz']} Review Text: The guy who does the narrating (the principle subject) has this style that doesn't seem like he'd like any kind of game show at all. But it kind of grows on you. There is a surprising amount of footage that captures all of his appearances. I thought there would be a little more scandal to it. It really should be titled The Contestant Who Knew a Fair Amount. There were some tones of stalker in him, but that helped my fascination. And Holly didn't have to fear him because well, ya know, I mean- ya know? She knew.

Also, at the time when he was young, he was a good looking guy, I think that's how the models kind of liked him. In his prime, it wasn't weird to ask for a kiss from Holly. It was really sad to see Bob Barker get older, because you see the pics of him when he was younger, and you just couldn't look more alive. For even someone that good looking to get old, damn, what's that say for the rest of us.

But I highly recommend this doc for sure for sure watch it. Review Title: A really good documentary Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/10/08 Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Sally Howell'], 'Producers': ['Heather Dreiling', 'Eric Schotz', 'Kathy Williamson'], 'Studio': ['MagellanTV']} Review Text: The narrator, who looks like the kind of guy who got beat up a lot in grammar school, is a little too alarmist, and rehashes stuff the main authority on sugar has already talked about. This goofball says he is serious about exercise and then says who needs a gym and walks up a hill with rocks. Wow. I've lived in England, and just like the rest of English TV, this seems like, I don't know- practice television, and a practice documentary. Also what I've noticed in English documentaries, they seem to be fascinated by the narrator WALKING. It must be a luxury in the UK to walk, or it must denote thinking. Anyway, I couldn't make it all the way through. Review Title: Couldn't make it to the end Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/10/10 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['---'], 'Producers': ['Paul Dechant'], 'Starring': ['Paul Dechant']} Review Text: The way we think about sugar is going to change; but not from this micro-mentary. I had a longer report about sugar in 5th grade. In about 300 seconds, this snippet talks about how there is sugar in food, and they made labels to know how much.

I have changed the way I think about sugar. Also, I wish I had the last 5 minutes of my life back. Review Title: Way too long Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/07/14 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Austin Meyer'], 'Producers': ['Austin Meyer'], 'Starring': ['Austin Meyer', 'Peter Braxton', 'Alex Charro'], 'Studio': ['AMC Plus Documentaries']} Review Text: This had me thinking the next day. Somebody told me about it, and I couldn't wait to watch it, even though I have nothing to do with patents. It's well told on a low budget and you'll find out why the budget is low. I could only slightly see the point of the other side, it was cool of Oscar Meyer to include them too, but in the balance, these patent trolls are very terrible people. Review Title: Best Doc in a long while Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/09/15 Average Rating: 3.5 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michal Siewierski'], 'Producers': ['Peter Eastwood', 'Nicky Taylor', 'Gwyn Whittaker'], 'Starring': ['John Mackey', 'Rich Roll', 'Rip Esselstyn'], 'Studio': ['Gravitas Ventures']} Review Text: I'm going to wait for the English speaking version. Review Title: Not sure Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Billion Dollar Bully Review Date: 2020/06/18 Categories: Documentary, Arts, Entertainment, and Culture Product Description: ["Today consumers Yelp everything from restaurants to dentists; plumbers to surgeons. The small business community sees Yelp's sales tactic as extortion. Does Yelp genuinely have an interest in helping people support the best local businesses, or are they a pay-to-play advertising platform?"] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kaylie Milliken'], 'Producers': ['Kaylie Milliken'], 'Starring': ['Davide Cerretini', 'Amy Lane', 'Danny Teran']} Review Text: Point of the Documentary: Reviews are corrupt.
Amazon: So . . . . whatja think?

Great Documentary. God, I could not stand the snarky tone of the Yelp reps on the phone, I felt like punting them from here on the West Coast all the way to Rhode Island. And to think the person actually exists. And that Jackie Reses phone call- so glad she was exposed.

I wish this documentary not so much put Yelp out of business, but held them more accountable. And I will take the advice of the person in the doc who said don't START advertising with them, because they won't let you stop. And it IS the company culture, those are young reps under pressure from within to get a stupid cow bell ring instead of enough money to pay their rent in SF.

They're a monopoly, take them down, and I am going to visit that guys' Italian restaurant in Richmond, and if you know Richmond, that's saying something. Review Title: Oh The Irony Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Florida Project [DVD] Review Date: 2020/08/03 Store: Willem Dafoe (Actor), Brooklynn Prince (Actor), Sean Baker (Director, Producer) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama Product Description: ['Product Description', "On the shabby grounds of an Orlando budget hotel, youngsters Moonee (Brooklynn Prince), Scooty (Christopher Rivera), and Jacey (Valeria Cotto) are left to fend for themselves as their struggling parents eke out an existence on the margins of the tourist trade. A summer marked by mischief, adventure, and the de facto guardianship of the facility's exasperated manager (Willem Dafoe) is memorably chronicled in this earthy, compelling drama. Bria Vinaite, Mela Murder, Caleb Landry Jones co-star.", 'Review', 'Special Features:Under the Rainbow: Making THE FLORIDA PROJECTBloopers and OuttakesCast and Crew Interviews --Lionsgate'] Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Dolby, NTSC, AC-3, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Sean Baker, Willem Dafoe, Brooklynn Prince', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 51 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.12 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Director': 'Sean Baker', 'Media Format': 'Dolby, NTSC, AC-3, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 51 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 20, 2018', 'Actors': 'Willem Dafoe, Brooklynn Prince', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Producers': 'Sean Baker', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: This movie is destined to be a cult classic. Review Title: Great Movie Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/09/03 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Starring': ['Andy Luttrell']} Review Text: I would not see this in a theatre, mainly because it's 4 minutes, and you would drive all the way out there, sit down, watch previews for 1/2 an hour, and then watch a 4 minute movie, and then drive home? Hell no. Review Title: I Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------
raw_response:
**Genuine Preferences and Patterns:**

- **Movie Genre Preference:** Strong inclination towards **comedies** and **dramas**, with a particular fondness for films featuring humor and heartwarming narratives.
- **Positive Ratings:** Frequently rates films highly (**4.0-5.0**) indicating a generally positive outlook on well-crafted cinema. 
- **Actor Favorites:** Shows a preference for known actors such as **Joe Pesci** and **Willem Dafoe**, suggesting admiration for familiar talent in performances.
- **Documentary Interest:** Engages with **documentaries**, especially those that tackle social issues or provide behind-the-scenes insights, often with critical reviews on content quality.
- **Mixed Reactions:** Displays varied reactions to films, with some rated poorly for content delivery or perceived self-indulgence in storytelling (e.g., critiques of narcissistic perspectives).
- **Nostalgia:** Tends toward films that evoke nostalgia, particularly those set in past eras or that reexamine formative experiences (like **Diner**).
- **Cultural Commentary:** Appreciates films that offer sociocultural critiques (e.g., perceptions of companies or consumerism).

Overall, the purchasing pattern reflects a blend of enjoyment of classic and contemporary films, a tendency towards critical analysis of content, and a preference for engaging narratives that provoke thought or laughter.

target_interaction.title: Nostalgic if you're older, not really for kids if you are a parent
target_interaction.text:
This does remind me of how the 70s really were, but they really did kind of promote violence back then- as a kid, it made me scared that people thought loud motorcycles and punching and putting a hatful of ketchup on someone was funny.

I liked the movie, and I'm by no means far left- I'm a conservative Republican BUT- the n word, wow. We didn't say that even in the 70s. Even in private. The F word, yea that happened a lot. But in my opinion, it didn't help the entertainment value of the movie.
